intro: Turnera marmorata, commonly known as the marble plant, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking, marbled-patterned leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often in the spring and summer. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a velvety texture. Turnera marmorata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ease of care.
